column4: Does anyone know of any documentation for setting up a virtual email server in ubuntu (I have an mx record pointed at my ip)
if you want a real full-blown server, my suggestion is to read a *lot* of docs
are you going to do SMTP forwarding, or will it act as a mail server?
ok, that wouldn't be too hard
I use a similar setup using fetchmail and nbsmtp
Can you suggest a good program? mybe even one with a nice GUI :D
oh um... *cough*
I haven't seen much by the way of an MTA and GUI
I have an actual working setup if you want that
yes please!
is nbsmtp in the breezy repos?
(I use hoary, and it isn't, so I compiled it)
one second
nah it's not... whats that for? I thought fetchmail was an smtp server?
fetchmail fetches your mail
it's a severely limited MTA
So fetchmail isn't really needed in what I want to do? I should be more concerned about nbsmtp?...
yeah, pretty much
fetchmail gets your mail, nbsmtp gives it
I'm a little concerned compiling my own software for an smtp server... because I couldn't be trusted to keep it updated... know of any other software packages that do the same job avaliable in repos?
nbsmtp is real simple to setup, assuming you use mutt, a tad bit harder if you don't, but still simple
yeah, I thought the same too, but nbsmtp really works for this purpose, it is the ``No-Brainer SMTP server'' :P
